question.body: Which type of anemia is not properly matched with its origin?

multiple_choice.choice: Iron deficiency anemia: Poor dietary intake of iron
Sickle cell anemia: Inherited disease most common among African Americans

response.feedback: Incorrect. Iron deficiency anemia can be caused by poor dietary intake of iron or blood loss.
Correct. Pernicious anemia is the result of poor intestinal absorption of B12, not blood loss.
Incorrect. Hemolytic anemia can result from a genetic condition or from specific drugs and toxins.
Incorrect. Sickle cell anemia is a genetic condition that is most common in African Americans.

multiple_choice.choice: The result of an iron deficiency in the diet.
A genetic disease that results in sickle shaped cells.
A genetic disease that affects the alpha or beta globin proteins.
A genetic disease that affects the heme portion of hemoglobulin

response.feedback: Incorrect. A dietary iron deficiency would result in Iron deficiency anemia.
Incorrect. A genetic disease that causes sickling of the cells is Sickle Cell Anemia.
Correct. This is a genetic disease where there is a mutation in either the alpha or beta globulin proteins.
Incorrect. It is a genetic disease but it is not a mutation of the heme group. It is a mutation in the alpha or beta globulin.
